member.name: M:RevSharp.Core.Client.#ctor
member.summary: Create instance of Client without a token set. You can change the token with , but only before is called.

member.name: M:RevSharp.Core.Client.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create an instance of the Client
member.param: Token to use for authentication
Does this token belong to a bot. This is important because for bots a different header is sent for HTTP requests.

member.summary: Set credentials. Must be called before .
member.param: Token to authenticate with.
Does the token belong to a bot.

member.name: M:RevSharp.Core.Client.SetCredentials(RevSharp.Core.Models.WebSocket.AuthenticateMessage,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set credentials and send a customized version of when connecting and authenticating with Bonfire (WebSocket server)
member.param: Customized authenticate message for Bonfire. will be set from field.
Does the token belong to a bot.

member.summary: Login with the given credentials. To set custom credentials after has been initialized, use .

member.name: M:RevSharp.Core.FeatureFlags.ParseBool(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses an environment variable as a boolean. When has been trimmed and made lowercase and it equals `true` it will return true, but anything else will return `false`. When the environment variable isn't found, it wil default to
member.param: Used when environment variable is not set.
member.returns: `true` when the environment variable is true, `false` when not true, when not found.

member.name: M:RevSharp.Core.FeatureFlags.ParseString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Just but when null it's

member.name: M:RevSharp.Core.FeatureFlags.ParseInt(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Parse an environment variable as .
- Fetch Environment variable (when null, set to as string) - Do regex match ^([0-9]+)$ - When success, parse item as integer then return - When fail, return default value

member.name: P:RevSharp.Core.FeatureFlags.WebsocketDebugLogging
member.summary:
Key: REVSHARP_DEBUG_WSLOG Default: false
Print to console all websocket messages sent/received.

member.name: P:RevSharp.Core.FeatureFlags.EnableLogColor
member.summary:
Key: REVSHARP_LOG_COLOR Default: true
Change console text/background color on logging.

member.name: P:RevSharp.Core.FeatureFlags.LogFlags
member.summary:
Key: REVSHARP_LOGFLAG Default: 30
What log level to use. Any log level with a value equal or lower than this will be printed.
Note: The value will be parsed as an integer then type casted to .

members.member: Manage the channel or channels on the server
Manage the server
Manage permissions on servers or channels
Manage roles on server
Manage server customisation (includes emoji)
Kick other members below their ranking
Ban other members below their ranking
Timeout other members below their ranking
Assign roles to members below their ranking
Change own nickname
Change or remove other's nicknames below their ranking
Change own avatar
Remove other's avatars below their ranking
View a channel
Read a channel's past message history
Send a message in a channel
Delete messages in a channel
Manage webhook entries on a channel
Create invites to this channel
Send embedded content in this channel
Send attachments and media in this channel
Masquerade messages using custom nickname and avatar
React to messages with emojis
Connect to a voice channel
Speak in a voice call
Share video in a voice call
Mute other members with lower ranking in a voice call
Deafen other members with lower ranking in a voice call
Move members between voice channels
Safely grant all permissions
Grant all permissions
